DOC.brief_summary: At present current practice provide course oral iron therapy patient post-operative haemoglobin normal , severe enough require blood transfusion . Such practice without side effect iron tablet , namely ingestion , nausea , diarrhoea , constipation . There little evidence literature support current practice use iron , one small randomise trial suggest therapy unnecessary . We propose recruit 300 patient recover hip fracture post-operative haemoglobin 11g/l . For patient willing enter study , half give oral iron therapy ( ferrous sulphate 200mg twice daily ) one month . The haemoglobin check patient attend hip fracture clinic 6 week discharge .
DOC.brief_title: Randomised Trial Comparing Iron Supplementation Versus Placebo Treatment Anaemia After Hip Fracture
